Simulating the Ecosystem¶

class biosim.simulation.BioSim(island_map, ini_pop, seed)[source]¶

This class instantiates an ecosystem simulation

Creates the variables associated with the class

Parameters:
  • island_map – multi line string
  • ini_pop – initial population in simulation
  • seed – random seed
add_population(population=None)[source]¶

Adds populations from a list of dictionaries The keys of the dictionaries have to be ‘species’, ‘age’ and ‘weight’

Parameters:population – list
heat_map(herbivore=True)[source]¶

Returns a heat-map, describing population density and movements

Parameters:herbivore – bool
Returns:plot
plot_pop_density()[source]¶

Plots the population density

Returns:plot
population_by_cell¶

Returns a DataFrame containing the number of each species per cell Columns: ‘x’, ‘y’, ‘Herbivores’, ‘Carnivores’

Returns:pandas.DataFrame
population_by_species¶

Returns a dictionary containing the number of animals for each species.

Returns:dict
sim_plot()[source]¶

Plots the results of the simulation

simulate(num_steps, vis_steps=None, img_steps=None)[source]¶

Conducting the simulation, deciding number of cycles.

Parameters:
  • num_steps – int
  • vis_steps – int
  • img_steps – int
total_animals¶

Returns the total number of animals

Returns:int
years_passed¶

Returns the number of years the BioSim instance has simulated

Returns:int
